chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Octavius Lamont Adams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Octavius Lamont Adams.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. For reasons stated on the record, court adjourns the matter for a scheduling conference. Court is willing to accept any cases for the purpose of a global resolution. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Octavius Lamont Adams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Octavius Lamont Adams.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Case set for a State v Lee hearing. Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests a preliminary hearing. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Defendant Octavius Lamont Adams in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Octavius Lamont Adams in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Octavius Lamont Adams appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3 AND 4. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  
This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
